intro: Lotononis involucrata subsp. peduncularis, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a cluster. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
